workflow.name: Analyze cryptocurrency market data with HTX API, GPT-4o and Telegram
workflow.description:
A fully autonomous, **HTX Spot Market AI Agent** **(Huobi AI Agent)** built using GPT-4o and Telegram. This workflow is the **primary interface**, orchestrating all internal reasoning, trading logic, and output formatting.

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è Core Features

* üß† **LLM-Powered Intelligence**: Built on GPT-4o with advanced reasoning
* ‚è±Ô∏è **Multi-Timeframe Support**: 15m, 1h, 4h, and 1d indicator logic
* üß© **Self-Contained Multi-Agent Workflow**: No external subflows required
* üßÆ **Real-Time HTX Market Data**: Live spot price, volume, 24h stats, and order book
* üì≤ **Telegram Bot Integration**: Interact via chat or schedule
* üîÑ **Autonomous Runs**: Support for webhook, schedule, or Telegram triggers

---

### üì• Input Examples

| User Input      | Agent Action                                  |
| --------------- | --------------------------------------------- |
| `btc`           | Returns 15m + 1h analysis for BTC             |
| `eth 4h`        | Returns 4-hour swing data for ETH             |
| `bnbusdt today` | Full day snapshot with technicals + 24h stats |

---

### üñ•Ô∏è Telegram Output Sample

```
üìä BTC/USDT Market Summary

üí∞ Price: $62,400  
üìâ 24h Stats: High $63,020 | Low $60,780 | Volume: 89,000 BTC

üìà 1h Indicators:
‚Ä¢ RSI: 68.1 ‚Üí Overbought  
‚Ä¢ MACD: Bearish crossover  
‚Ä¢ BB: Tight squeeze forming  
‚Ä¢ ADX: 26.5 ‚Üí Strengthening trend

üìâ Support: $60,200  
üìà Resistance: $63,800
```

---

### üõ†Ô∏è Setup Instructions

1. **Create your Telegram Bot** using [@BotFather](https://t.me/BotFather)
2. **Add Bot Token** in n8n Telegram credentials
3. **Add your GPT-4o or OpenAI-compatible key** under HTTP credentials in n8n
4. *(Optional)* Add your [HTX API](https://www.htx.com/en-us/opend/) credentials if expanding to authenticated endpoints
5. Deploy this main workflow using:

   * ‚úÖ Webhook (HTTP Request Trigger)
   * ‚úÖ Telegram messages
   * ‚úÖ Cron / Scheduled automation

---

### üé• Live Demo

[![Watch the Live Demo](https://img.youtube.com/vi/Crr41F8tr0Q/hqdefault.jpg)](https://youtu.be/Crr41F8tr0Q?si=hZv_WRY2ZOA9-Y0V)  

---

### üß† Internal Architecture

| Component          | Role                                                     |
| ------------------ | -------------------------------------------------------- |
| üîÑ Telegram Trigger | Entry point for external or manual signal                |
| üß† GPT-4o          | Symbol + timeframe extraction + strategy generation      |
| üìä Data Collector  | Internal tools fetch price, indicators, order book, etc. |
| üßÆ Reasoning Layer | Merges everything into a trading signal summary          |
| üí¨ Telegram Output | Sends formatted HTML report via Telegram                 |

---

### üìå Use Case Examples

| Scenario                               | Outcome                                                 |
| -------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Auto-run every 4 hours                 | Sends new HTX signal summary to Telegram                |
| Human requests ‚Äúeth 1h‚Äù                | Bot replies with real-time 1h chart-based summary       |
| System-wide trigger from another agent | Invokes webhook and returns response to parent workflow |

---

### üßæ Licensing & Attribution

¬© 2025 **Treasurium Capital Limited Company**
Architecture, prompts, and trade report structure are IP-protected.

**No unauthorized rebranding permitted.**

üîó **For support:** [Don Jayamaha ‚Äì LinkedIn](https://linkedin.com/in/donjayamahajr)

nodes.name: Splits message is more than 4000 characters

parameters.content:
## Trigger Incoming Telegram Command
Node: Telegram Trigger
**Listens for new Telegram messages** from users.
Triggers the full agent process and passes raw user input downstream.

## Validate User Access
Node: User **Authentication
Checks incoming Telegram ID** against the approved user list.

## Generate Session Metadata
Node: Add S**essionId
Creates a sessionId using the Telegram chat_id**.
This is passed into all downstream tools for memory and workflow routing.

## Main AI Agent: Data Fetcher (HTX)

**Node: HTX Data Agent**
This is the **core orchestrator**. It uses OpenAI **only to format and present raw HTX market data**, not to analyze or generate strategies.

It has direct **HTTP request access** to the **HTX REST API** (`https://api.huobi.pro`) and retrieves:

* **Live Price (Aggregated Ticker)** ‚Äî `/market/detail/merged`
  Returns best bid/ask + last trade price, volume, turnover.

* **24h Market Summary** ‚Äî `/market/detail`
  Rolling 24-hour stats: open, high, low, close, volume, amount, count.

* **Market Depth** ‚Äî `/market/depth`
  Order book bids/asks up to requested step/levels.

* **Full Order Book** ‚Äî `/market/fullMbp`
  Complete market depth, up to **5000 levels**, refreshed once per second.

* **Last Trade** ‚Äî `/market/trade`
  The latest executed trade.

* **Recent Trades** ‚Äî `/market/history/trade`
  Most recent trades list.

* **Klines (Candlesticks)** ‚Äî `/market/history/kline`
  Supports multiple intervals (`1s, 1min, 5min, 15min, 1day, 1week, 1mon, 1year`, etc.).
  The AI chooses the correct interval keyword (`seconds, minutes, days, weeks, months, years`).

## Handle Telegram Message Limits
Node: Code (split logic)
Checks if the **GPT output exceeds 4000 characters**.
If so, it splits the message into safe chunks and passes them on sequentially.

## Send Final Report to Telegram
Node: Telegram sendMessage
Sends **formatted HTML report (or split chunks)** directly to the authenticated user via Telegram bot.

## GPT Model for Reasoning
Node: OpenAI Chat Model
Model: **gpt-4o-mini**
Used to:

Interpret signal values

Generate structured HTML

**Recommend spot and leverage trades**

### **Order Book Depth**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/depth`

**What it does:** Returns the **order book snapshot** (bids/asks) for a trading pair up to the requested depth level.

**Params:**
- `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., `btcusdt` (lowercase, no dash)
- `type` (STRING, required) ‚Üí depth aggregation level (`step0`‚Äì`step5`)
  - `step0` = no aggregation (full precision)
  - `step1` = aggregated to 1 decimal place
  - ‚Ä¶ up to `step5`
- `depth` (INT, optional) ‚Üí max entries per side (default 20, max 150)

**Returns:** `ts`, `tick.bids: [[price, qty], ...]`, `tick.asks: [[price, qty], ...]`

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
type   = $fromAI('parameters1_Value', 'step0', 'string')
depth  = $fromAI('parameters2_Value', 20, 'number')
```

**Notes:** For lightweight quick book snapshot, use `step0` with smaller depth (20/50).

### **Best Bid/Ask (Order Book Ticker)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/detail/merged`

**What it does:** Returns the best **bid/ask** snapshot along with the latest trade price for a symbol.

**Params:**
- `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., `btcusdt` (lowercase, no dash)

**Returns:** `tick.bid` = `[price, qty]`, `tick.ask` = `[price, qty]`

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
```

**Notes:** Use lowercase symbols without `-` or `/` (e.g., `btcusdt`).

## Short-Term Memory Module
Node: **Simple Memory
Stores the sessionId**, symbol, and other state data.
Useful for:

Multi-turn Telegram interactions

Tracking indicator agreement across timeframes

### **24h Stats (Ticker Detail)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/detail`
**What it does:** Returns the **24h rolling summary** for a single HTX spot symbol: **open/high/low/close**, **amount (base volume)**, **vol (quote turnover)**, and **trade count**.

**Params:**
- `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., `btcusdt` (lowercase, no dash)

**Returns (core fields):** `ts`, `tick.open`, `tick.close`, `tick.high`, `tick.low`, `tick.amount`, `tick.vol`, `tick.count`.

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
```

**Notes:** For all symbols at once, use `GET /market/tickers`.

### **Price (Latest)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/detail/merged`

**What it does:** Returns the **latest trade price**, best bid/ask, and other snapshot details for a symbol.

**Params:**
- `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., `btcusdt` (lowercase, no dash)

**Returns:** `tick.close` = last trade price, plus bid/ask/volumes.

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
```

**Notes:** Use lowercase symbols without `-` or `/` (e.g., `btcusdt`).

### **Klines (Candles)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/history/kline`

**What it does:** Returns candlestick data for a symbol/interval.

**Params:**
- `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí lowercase (e.g., `btcusdt`)
- `period` (ENUM, required ‚Äî e.g., `1min,5min,15min,30min,60min,4hour,1day,1mon,1week,1year`)
- `size` (INT, optional, default 20, max 2000)

**Returns (array per candle):** `[id, open, close, low, high, amount, vol, count]`

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
period = $fromAI('parameters1_Value', '15min', 'string')
size   = $fromAI('parameters2_Value', 20, 'number')
```

**Notes:**
- Use lowercase symbols without `-` (e.g., `btcusdt`).
- If no `size` provided, defaults to 20 latest candles.

### **Merged Ticker (Bid/Ask/Last)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/detail/merged`
**What it does:** Returns best bid/ask and last price for a symbol. Use Calculator to derive a midpoint `(bid+ask)/2` if you need an average.

**Params:** `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí lowercase, no dash (e.g., `btcusdt`)

**Returns (key fields):** `tick.bid`, `tick.ask`, `tick.close`, `tick.high`, `tick.low`, `tick.amount`, `tick.vol`, `ts`

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
```

**Notes:** HTX has no direct avg-price endpoint; this is the canonical ticker to pair with Calculator for midpoint.

### **Recent Trades**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/history/trade`
**What it does:** Returns the most recent trades for a given symbol.

**Params:**
* `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí lowercase, no dash (e.g., `btcusdt`)
* `size` (INT, default 100, max 2000 ‚Äî we set default 100)

**Returns:** array of trade batches ‚Üí each batch has `data: [{id, price, amount, direction, ts}]`

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
size   = $fromAI('parameters1_Value', 100, 'number')
```

**Notes:** Unlike Binance, HTX nests trades inside `data` arrays per batch.

parameters.description:
### üè∑ Tool: **Think**

**Purpose:**

* Lightweight **reasoning helper**.
* Lets the AI Agent process intermediate logic, format outputs, or decide how to combine multiple API results before sending the final report.
* Does not fetch data itself.

**Use cases:**

* Clean/reshape JSON from Binance endpoints
* Extract only the needed fields (e.g., `lastPrice`, `volume`)
* Help prepare data for Telegram message formatting

**n8n setup notes:**

* No API call, just an **AI Tool** node.
* Connect upstream API results ‚Üí Think ‚Üí Report Agent.

parameters.content:
### **Calculator**

**Purpose:**

* Perform **math operations** inside the workflow.
* Supports add/subtract/multiply/divide, percentages, rounding, etc.

**Use cases:**

* Calculate spreads (ask ‚Äì bid)
* Compute % changes from open vs. last price
* Normalize volumes or confidence scores

**n8n setup notes:**

* Node: `Calculator` (n8n built-in)
* Input fields can come from Binance API JSON
* Output can be chained into Think ‚Üí Final Report

### **Think**

**Purpose:**

* Lightweight **reasoning helper**.
* Lets the AI Agent process intermediate logic, format outputs, or decide how to combine multiple API results before sending the final report.
* Does not fetch data itself.

**Use cases:**

* Clean/reshape JSON from Binance endpoints
* Extract only the needed fields (e.g., `lastPrice`, `volume`)
* Help prepare data for Telegram message formatting

**n8n setup notes:**

* No API call, just an **AI Tool** node.
* Connect upstream API results ‚Üí Think ‚Üí Report Agent.

options.systemMessage:
You are the **HTX Spot Market Data Agent**.

You have **HTTP request access** to the official **HTX REST API** (`https://api.huobi.pro`) to retrieve spot market data for any requested trading pair.

Your job is to **fetch and present raw market data only**.  
You do **not** analyze, predict, or recommend.

---

## üîó Available Endpoints

1. **Live Price (Aggregated Ticker)**  
   `GET /market/detail/merged`  
   ‚Ä¢ Returns best bid/ask, last trade price, volume, turnover.

2. **24h Market Summary**  
   `GET /market/detail`  
   ‚Ä¢ 24h stats: open, high, low, close, volume, amount, count.

3. **Market Depth**  
   `GET /market/depth`  
   ‚Ä¢ Order book bids/asks (step/levels configurable).

4. **Full Order Book**  
   `GET /market/fullMbp`  
   ‚Ä¢ Complete market depth (up to 5000 levels).

5. **Last Trade**  
   `GET /market/trade`  
   ‚Ä¢ Most recent single trade.

6. **Recent Trades**  
   `GET /market/history/trade`  
   ‚Ä¢ List of recent trades.

7. **Klines (Candlesticks)**  
   `GET /market/history/kline`  
   ‚Ä¢ Multiple intervals supported (`1s, 1min, 5min, 15min, 1day, 1week, 1mon, 1year`).  
   ‚Ä¢ The AI automatically selects the correct interval (`seconds, minutes, days, weeks, months, years`).

---

## üì§ Output Format

Always respond in **clean, structured text** (Telegram HTML). Example:

```

BTC-USDT ‚Äî HTX Spot Data

Price
‚Ä¢ Last: 58000.12
‚Ä¢ Change (24h): +2.4%

24h Stats
‚Ä¢ Open: 56500 ‚Ä¢ High: 58500 ‚Ä¢ Low: 56200
‚Ä¢ Volume: 12,430 BTC ‚Ä¢ Turnover: 720M USDT

Order Book (Top 5)
‚Ä¢ Bids: \[57990 x 0.5], \[57980 x 1.2], ‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Asks: \[58010 x 0.8], \[58020 x 1.5], ‚Ä¶

Klines (15m, latest 5)
‚Ä¢ O/H/L/C: 57800 / 58020 / 57750 / 57990

```

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Rules

* Always **call the correct HTX API endpoint**.  
* Do **not** fabricate or calculate values (except simple formatting).  
* Do **not** output raw JSON.  
* Do **not** give advice, predictions, or strategies.  
* If data is missing, output `N/A`.
```

parameters.toolDescription:
### üè∑ Tool: **24h Stats (Ticker Detail)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/detail`
**What it does:** Returns the **24h rolling summary** for a single HTX spot symbol: **open/high/low/close**, **amount (base volume)**, **vol (quote turnover)**, and **trade count**.

**Params:**
- `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., `btcusdt` (lowercase, no dash)

**Returns (core fields):** `ts`, `tick.open`, `tick.close`, `tick.high`, `tick.low`, `tick.amount`, `tick.vol`, `tick.count`.

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
```

**Notes:** For all symbols at once, use `GET /market/tickers`.

### üè∑ Tool: **Order Book Depth**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/depth`

**What it does:** Returns the **order book snapshot** (bids/asks) for a trading pair up to the requested depth level.

**Params:**
- `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., `btcusdt` (lowercase, no dash)
- `type` (STRING, required) ‚Üí depth aggregation level (`step0`‚Äì`step5`)
  - `step0` = no aggregation (full precision)
  - `step1` = aggregated to 1 decimal place
  - ‚Ä¶ up to `step5`
- `depth` (INT, optional) ‚Üí max entries per side (default 20, max 150)

**Returns:** `ts`, `tick.bids: [[price, qty], ...]`, `tick.asks: [[price, qty], ...]`

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
type   = $fromAI('parameters1_Value', 'step0', 'string')
depth  = $fromAI('parameters2_Value', 20, 'number')
```

**Notes:** For lightweight quick book snapshot, use `step0` with smaller depth (20/50).

### üè∑ Tool: **Price (Latest)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/detail/merged`

**What it does:** Returns the **latest trade price**, best bid/ask, and other snapshot details for a symbol.

**Params:**
- `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., `btcusdt` (lowercase, no dash)

**Returns:** `tick.close` = last trade price, plus bid/ask/volumes.

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
```

**Notes:** Use lowercase symbols without `-` or `/` (e.g., `btcusdt`).

### üè∑ Tool: **Best Bid/Ask (Order Book Ticker)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/detail/merged`

**What it does:** Returns the best **bid/ask** snapshot along with the latest trade price for a symbol.

**Params:**
- `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí e.g., `btcusdt` (lowercase, no dash)

**Returns:** `tick.bid` = `[price, qty]`, `tick.ask` = `[price, qty]`

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
```

**Notes:** Use lowercase symbols without `-` or `/` (e.g., `btcusdt`).

### üè∑ Tool: **Klines (Candles)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/history/kline`

**What it does:** Returns candlestick data for a symbol/interval.

**Params:**
- `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí lowercase (e.g., `btcusdt`)
- `period` (ENUM, required ‚Äî e.g., `1min,5min,15min,30min,60min,4hour,1day,1mon,1week,1year`)
- `size` (INT, optional, default 20, max 2000)

**Returns (array per candle):** `[id, open, close, low, high, amount, vol, count]`

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
period = $fromAI('parameters1_Value', '15min', 'string')
size   = $fromAI('parameters2_Value', 20, 'number')
```

**Notes:**
- Use lowercase symbols without `-` (e.g., `btcusdt`).
- If no `size` provided, defaults to 20 latest candles.

### üè∑ Tool: **Merged Ticker (Bid/Ask/Last)**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/detail/merged`
**What it does:** Returns best bid/ask and last price for a symbol. Use Calculator to derive a midpoint `(bid+ask)/2` if you need an average.

**Params:** `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí lowercase, no dash (e.g., `btcusdt`)

**Returns (key fields):** `tick.bid`, `tick.ask`, `tick.close`, `tick.high`, `tick.low`, `tick.amount`, `tick.vol`, `ts`

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
```

**Notes:** HTX has no direct avg-price endpoint; this is the canonical ticker to pair with Calculator for midpoint.

### üè∑ Tool: **Recent Trades**

**Endpoint:** `GET /market/history/trade`
**What it does:** Returns the most recent trades for a given symbol.

**Params:**
* `symbol` (STRING, required) ‚Üí lowercase, no dash (e.g., `btcusdt`)
* `size` (INT, default 100, max 2000 ‚Äî we set default 100)

**Returns:** array of trade batches ‚Üí each batch has `data: [{id, price, amount, direction, ts}]`

**n8n query mapping:**
```txt
symbol = $fromAI('parameters0_Value', 'btcusdt', 'string')
size   = $fromAI('parameters1_Value', 100, 'number')
```

**Notes:** Unlike Binance, HTX nests trades inside `data` arrays per batch.

parameters.content: # üß† HTX Spot Market Data AI Agent ‚Äì Full System Documentation A specialized AI automation system for **HTX (Huobi) spot market data retrieval**. It fetches and formats **live market data** only ‚Äî **no predictions, no strategies**. Outputs are structured into **Telegram-ready reports** for traders and analysts. --- ## üß© Included Workflows You must install and activate **all of the following workflows/tools** for the system to function: | ‚úÖ Workflow / Tool Name | üìå Function Description | | ---------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | HTX AI Agent | Core orchestrator. Calls HTX REST APIs and formats raw data into Telegram-ready reports. | | 24h Stats Tool | Pulls rolling 24-hour OHLC, volume, and trade count for a symbol. | | Price (Latest) Tool | Fetches the latest trade price and best bid/ask. | | Best Bid/Ask Tool | Returns top-of-book bid/ask snapshot. | | Order Book Depth Tool | Retrieves order book bids/asks with configurable depth aggregation. | | Klines (Candles) Tool | Returns OHLCV candlestick data for configurable intervals (1m‚Äì1y). | | Recent Trades Tool | Shows most recent executed trades. | | Average Price Tool | Computes midpoint between bid/ask using Calculator (HTX has no direct avg-price). | | Calculator | Performs math inside workflow (e.g., spreads, % changes). | | Think | Lightweight reasoning helper (JSON cleanup, formatting). | | Simple Memory | Stores `sessionId` and symbol state for continuity across Telegram interactions. | --- ## ‚öôÔ∏è Installation Instructions ### Step 1: Import Workflows * Open **n8n Editor UI** * Import the JSON file(s) provided (`HTX AI Agent v1.02.json`) * Activate the workflows ### Step 2: Set Credentials * **OpenAI API Credential** ‚Üí for GPT-4.1-mini (formatting only) * **Telegram API Credential** ‚Üí Bot key for sending/receiving messages * **HTX Market Data** ‚Üí No auth required (public endpoints) ### Step 3: Configure Webhook & Auth * Update the **Telegram ID Check node** with your personal Telegram ID * Only this ID can trigger the agent ### Step 4: Deploy & Test * Send a symbol (e.g., `btcusdt`) to your Telegram bot * Agent retrieves live data and formats into a clean HTML report --- ## üñ•Ô∏è System Workflow Overview ``` [Telegram Trigger] ‚Üí [User Authentication] ‚Üí [Add SessionId + Memory] ‚Üí [HTX AI Agent] ‚Ü≥ (24h Stats, Price, Best Bid/Ask, Order Book, Klines, Trades) ‚Ü≥ (Calculator + Think for cleanup/formatting) ‚Üí [Split Messages > 4000 chars] ‚Üí [Telegram SendMessage] ``` --- ## üì¨ Telegram Output Style ```html HTX Market Data ‚Äì BTCUSDT Price ‚Ä¢ Last: 58,000.12 ‚Ä¢ Best Bid: 57,990 | Best Ask: 58,010 24h Stats ‚Ä¢ Open: 56,500 | High: 58,500 | Low: 56,200 ‚Ä¢ Volume: 12,430 BTC | Turnover: 720M USDT Order Book (Top 5) ‚Ä¢ Bids: [57,990 x 0.5], [57,980 x 1.2] ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¢ Asks: [58,010 x 0.8], [58,020 x 1.5] ‚Ä¶ Klines (15m, last 3) ‚Ä¢ O/H/L/C: 57,800 / 58,020 / 57,750 / 57,990 ``` --- ## ‚ö†Ô∏è Rules * Only fetch and format data ‚Äî **no trading signals or advice** * Always use lowercase symbols (e.g., `btcusdt`) * Do not output raw JSON ‚Äî must be formatted for Telegram * If data missing ‚Üí show `N/A` --- ## üöÄ Support & Licensing üîó **Don Jayamaha ‚Äì LinkedIn** [linkedin.com/in/donjayamahajr](http://linkedin.com/in/donjayamahajr) ¬© 2025 Treasurium Capital Limited Company. All rights reserved. This system architecture, prompts, and workflow structure are proprietary and protected by **U.S. copyright law**. Reuse or resale prohibited without license.
